page.title: 10BEVENDEAN FROM 1902
page.content: Originally Bevendean was an agricultural area.There was no public transport of any kind.There was a farm owned by the Allcorn family. They had chickens and cows but no pigs.There were a lot of cow pats where the shops are now!!!There were no cars so the Allcorn's used a horse drawn wagon to get to market.Along Plymouth Avenue grew barley & oats.The first building was built in 1920. The roads were very rocky and dusty. By 1930 all the houses in the Avenue had been finished.The church and the houses behind the school were not built until after the World War Two. The school was built in 1949. At first the tram only ran to Coombe Road.When buses were first introduced to Bevendean the fare was only 2p.(RETURN!) from the centre of Brighton.
